title: Derby’s Take: Fed Payment System Crash Puts Spotlight on Digital Dollar Project
body:
A short but broad-based failure Wednesday in the Federal Reserve’s widely used payment system will likely increase pressure on the central bank to modernize its infrastructure systems, and could help speed the adoption of a fully digital dollar.
The payment system for several hours couldn’t move money between banks and financial firms because of an “operational error,” the Fed said. The system was restored late in the day, and the central bank said there could be processing backlogs. A cyberattack didn’t appear to cause the...
